---
title: "Analysis of World Population"
description: |
  This website would give you an idea about the current world population and different indices based upon population.
site: distill::distill_website
---

```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = FALSE)
library(distill)
library(rvest)
library(tidyverse)
library(ggthemes)
# library()
# Learn more about creating websites with Distill at:
# https://rstudio.github.io/distill/website.html

# Learn more about publishing to GitHub Pages at:
# https://rstudio.github.io/distill/publish_website.html#github-pages

pop_den_grow <- read.csv('Population, Growth and Density Data.csv')
loan <- read.csv('Loan Progression.csv')
economics_life <- merge(x = pop_den_grow, y = loan)
economics_life <- economics_life |>
  drop_na() |>
  mutate(GrowthRate = 100 * (GrowthRate - 1))
```

*Population vs Growth Rate*

```{r}
economics_life |>
    select(pop2022, GrowthRate, continent) |>
    ggplot(aes(GrowthRate, log(pop2022), color = continent)) +
    geom_point() +
    theme_minimal()+
    labs(title = "Relation between the population and growth rate in 2022",
         y = "Population (log scale)",
         x = "Growth Rate",
         color = "Continent")
    
```

```{r}

# Population and Density
economics_life |>
  drop_na() |>
  select(pop2022, Density, continent) |>
  ggplot(aes(log(Density), log(pop2022), color = continent)) +
  geom_point()

```

```{r}
economics_life |>
  drop_na() |>
  select(area, Density, continent) |>
  ggplot(aes(log(Density), area, color = continent)) +
  geom_point()

```
```{r}
economics_life |>
    select(GrowthRate, Income.group, Region, continent) |>
    ggplot(aes(x = GrowthRate, y = Income.group, color = continent)) +
    geom_point()
```
